text: DT measles outbreaks continue to spread , with NNP York City declaring a JJ NN emergency and requiring NNS in four ZIP codes to have their NNS vaccinated or face penalties , including a fine of NNP $ 1,000 and or imprisonment . Since September 2018 , 285 measles NNS have been reported in Brooklyn and Queens , mainly in neighborhoods where ultra-Orthodox Jews have chosen to not have their NNS vaccinated . DT Centers for NNP Control and Prevention , VBD IN from Jan. 1 to April 4 , 2019 , 465 individual NNS of measles have been confirmed in CD NNS . This is DT second - highest number of NNS since DT CDC declared measles eliminated in 2000 ; in 2014 , 667 NNS occurred . NNS have still been occurring each NN , often brought into DT NNP NNPS from international travelers . Officials believe DT to be DT cause of DT outbreak in Rockland County , NNP York , where 168 NNS were reported as of April 8 , 2019 . Rockland JJ NN officials issued a ban WDT MD keep unvaccinated NNS out of JJ places , but a judge overruled DT on April 5 . On April 9 , county officials VBD PRP MD appeal . But EX are limits to what NN care providers , JJ NN officials and legislators can do . PRP is crucial to consider both DT power – and DT limits – of potential solutions WDT will provide education , JJ care and protection for DT NN while still upholding principles of informed consent , parental decision - making and sustaining JJ trust . As a professor who researches and teaches NN law , JJ NN law and JJ ethics , I VBP PRP ’s worth clarifying what NNS can or cannot legally do when responding to NNS of communicable NN . DT law recognizes DT right of an individual to refuse JJ interventions . NN law has a strong history of recognizing bodily integrity : Adults can choose whether to accept or reject a proposed JJ intervention , even in instances where JJ NN authorities conclude a NN MD benefit both DT individual and society . DT Supreme Court has recognized parents ’ ability to direct DT care and control of their NNS , including consenting or forgoing JJ treatment for their child except in very specific circumstances . In DT 1905 Jacobson v. Massachusetts case , DT Supreme Court upheld a NN law delegating power to local NN officials mandating IN adults receive CD smallpox NN in DT midst of an epidemic or pay a fine ( about $ 130 today ) . Under DT concept of police power , NNS have a duty to enact laws WDT promote DT NN , safety and welfare of its residents . JJ NN authorities MD offer NNS as a method of prevention , but JJ professionals , JJ NN authorities and even courts MD not legally compel a person to submit to a NN . DT Jacobson decision RB set forth limits on police power , yet subsequent NNS addressing NN mandates discarded these requirements , extending multiple NN mandates to school attendance for NN not in circulation and in DT absence of an epidemic . Deferring to respected scientific consensus as a means to justify forced JJ interventions in DT name of individual benefit and DT JJ good has historically resulted in some of DT most egregious constitutional and human rights atrocities in DT U.S . DT mass forcible sterilization during DT eugenics movement is but CD example . DT history of NN and medicine further demonstrates DT fallibility of commonly accepted JJ knowledge , such as when Bayer introduced heroin as a safe , non-addictive substitute for morphine , or physicians prescribed Bendectin and thalidomide to relieve nausea , only to find these medications resulted in babies born with severe birth defects . DT law is RB quite clear IN JJ NN authorities and law enforcement MD place restrictions on a person ’s individual liberty – including religious liberty – in situations where a person ’s actions pose a direct , immediate and compelling harm to others , such as using venomous snakes in religious worship or asserting a nonexistent “ right ” to use an illegal substance such as marijuana when operating a motor vehicle . In JJ NN law relating to communicable NN , this constitutes a very specific standard : A person must have a present NN , and this person ’s actions must pose a direct threat to others . For example , NN officials MD seek a quarantine order or civil commitment for a person with active tuberculosis who continues to frequent highly populated JJ spaces until DT person is no longer contagious . Even in such a case , NN authorities can offer treatment and limit a person ’s movement to prevent infecting others , but DT law does not permit forcibly medicating a competent person against his will . Accordingly , legal precedent does not support quarantining vast geographic areas of healthy persons who have not been exposed to DT communicable illness , but MD support tailored voluntary isolation and quarantine of persons who have been exposed to , or currently have , DT illness . What NN officials can do to protect NNS DT CDC classifies NNS as CD of DT top 10 JJ NN achievements . DT vast majority ( about 98 % ) of parents across DT U.S. as a whole comply with DT NN law mandated schedule of NNS for their NNS . NNS , IN any other FDA - approved product such as a prescription drug or JJ device , carry a set of risks and benefits . These calculations vary depending on DT NN , its efficacy , safety , potential side effects , DT severity of DT illness DT NN aims to protect against , and DT individual to whom PRP is administered . NN NN and practice similarly evolved with historical mistakes ( DT Cutter incident ) and ongoing disputes about risks and benefits for individual NNS IN NN and anthrax . To promote NN for NNS , NN officials MD offer educational campaigns and set up free clinics for parents to bring their NNS . NN laws MD RB mandate NNS as a condition for school attendance , or require excluding unvaccinated NNS during an active outbreak at their school . However , if NNS offer a religious or nonmedical exemption , courts have been clear IN NN officials and school officials do not have discretion to require DT child ’s parent to identify with an organized religion or reject DT sincerity of DT parent ’s beliefs because this violates DT First Amendment . JJ NN professionals worry IN parents who forgo NN are placing their child and DT community at risk . Some have advocated IN DT NN should step in with coercive measures such as eliminating any nonmedical exemptions for all NNS or intervene by force , such as classifying parents ’ decision as child neglect or seeking a court order to vaccinate DT child . In my opinion , these strategies rely on a distortion of legal precedent , dismiss longstanding authority of parents to make decisions for their NNS , and threaten to undermine an already fractured JJ trust . NNS WDT uphold NN intervention to protect a child by compelling JJ treatment generally require IN DT child has an illness , DT illness is severe and life - threatening , and DT risks and benefits of intervening are assessed . This requires JJ professionals and NN officials to maintain precision in distinguishing whether DT parents are deciding to forgo recommended NNS , or whether PRP are refusing JJ care for a critically ill child . Indeed , a recent case in Chandler , Arizona , demonstrated how a NN of coercion and force MD result in parental fear and refusal to constructively engage with NN officials for even an ill child . NN JJ NN officials have DT duty to protect residents from illness and communicable NN , but these strategies must fall within appropriate legal parameters . Dismissing these legal boundaries or justifying unnecessary force not only undermines fundamental liberties , but in my view fuels parental and community distrust of NN officials and sets back DT ultimate goals of protecting DT NN .

text: Pathogens are microbes WDT cause diseases . NNS allow a dead or altered form of DT NN causing pathogen to be introduced into DT body , which contain a specific antigen . text: After NNS of deflection and foot - dragging , DT major tech companies are finally having to take steps toward policing their own content . PRP have reached this point kicking and screaming , under great JJ pressure , after clinging for NNS to DT fiction WDT PRP are just JJ utilities and IN NNS can use their pipes for pretty much anything . But now PRP have VBN , for a brief moment at least , against a major NN theorist . Facebook , Apple , YouTube and Spotify have all taken action against Alex Jones . PRP are deathly afraid of being accused of political bias , sometimes for good reason . Both Facebook and Twitter have both grappled with incidents of discrimination against conservatives , which MD have made them gun-shy about banning ( as opposed to shadow - banning ) some folks . But almost in unison , DT tech giants teamed up against Jones , who runs Infowars . Candidate Donald NNP appeared on Jones ' online show in 2015 , and yesterday Jones tweeted a video defense with DT headline : " EMERGENCY : NNP NNP Must Defend DT First Amendment . " Facebook VBD PRP has taken down some Jones pages " for glorifying violence , which violates our graphic violence policy , and using dehumanizing language to describe NNS who are transgender , Muslims and immigrants , which violates our hate speech policies . " Apple VBD PRP removed DT " Alex Jones Show " and other podcasts from iTunes and its podcast app . Jones apologized last NN , in careful language , for spreading DT phony Pizzagate NN theory , saying he'd been given inaccurate information . DT ’s not " conservative . " DT 's at odds with reality . Separately , Jones called DT NNP York Times a " globalist intelligence agency " and VBD IN DT " evil , wicked sociopaths " who work for major NN outlets were teaming up to take down Infowars . I confess I 'd VB to VB how DT four tech companies happened to take action on DT same day . Perhaps PRP concluded EX was safety in numbers . PRP seemed to have an ally in Drudge , whose banner headline was " APPLE REGULATES HATE . " But this is just a skirmish . Just recently , Mark Zuckerberg got himself into trouble by saying he saw no reason to ban pages by Holocaust deniers . EX is a fine line between banning hate and bullying on CD hand and censoring controversial political opinions on DT other . These battles will play out in a hyperpartisan political atmosphere . text: This article is more than 3 NNS old . Bullshit , James Ball tells me , can VB PRP into DT Oval Office . DT former Guardian journalist and now special correspondent at BuzzFeed is well versed in separating fact from fiction . As a young reporter fresh out of university he started as an intern at WikiLeaks , working on DT verification and publication of confidential NNP documents in 2010 , and then on DT Snowden leaks in 2013 during his NN at DT Guardian . DT ’s all to say he ’s developed a sixth sense for what is , and is n’t , bullshit . With this in mind , today Ball is publishing his debut book as a solo author on DT fake NN phenomenon which has engulfed DT NN of politics over DT last NN . PRP sat down with Ball to find out how half - truths , untruths and outright fakery took over : Fake NN , post - truths and bullshit , is this a JJ phenomenon ? This definitely is n't JJ : newspapers have run questionable stories for as long as PRP 've existed , and fake NN has circulated DT web for just as long . But things have changed a bit – fake NN got political last NN , because DT was DT way to VB huge audiences . So PRP 's some old trends WDT have suddenly really come to DT fore . So who 's to blame for fake NN ? Russia ! More seriously – all of PRP . Fake NN is just DT most visible bit of what is a whole ecosystem of half - truths , untruths and outright fakery , or in other words , of bullshit . When PRP share a story without thinking about PRP or checking , PRP 're part of DT system . When a hyper - partisan NN site ( VB Breitbart or DT Canary ) over - hypes and spins a kernel of truth into something much bigger , DT 's part of PRP . When mainstream outlets run too - good - to - check stories , PRP 're part of PRP . And when Facebook and others profit off this whole system , PRP 're part of PRP too . Are EX examples of fake NN causing real harm ? DT Pizzagate NN – an alt - right theory IN pizza parlours were harbouring secret child abuse sites used by leading democrats – led to an armed man storming a DC pizza parlour . So DT consequences of this stuff can be very real . Polling shows Republicans believe Obama wiretapped NNP ( EX 's no evidence he did ) , while JJ Democrats believe NNP election machines themselves were hacked ( EX 's no evidence of this either ) . When PRP all believe different facts , PRP can't have a JJ conversation – PRP can only have a shouting match . So what 's DT solution ? Will PRP ever be free of fake NN ? DT upside of all of PRP being part of DT problem is IN PRP can all be part of DT solution . PRP need to find ways to make corrections reach as JJ NNS as DT initial bad reports and hoaxes do . PRP 've got to find JJ ways to cover politicians and campaigns which deploy bullshit to win . EX 's no CD big fix , but EX 's lots of little things all of PRP can do . DT fightback can start whenever PRP VBP . Post - Truth : How Bullshit Conquered DT NNP is available now on Kindle and in paperback . This article originally appeared on DT Memo

text: Picture adult engagement with information as a continuum . On CD side sits intentional ( or actively sought ) information , and on DT other lives seemingly incidental ( or passively received ) information ( see Figure 1 ) . In this section , PRP address DT two ends of this continuum and then discuss DT space in between . Our continuum is based entirely on work in schools and with teachers ; however , a reviewer of earlier drafts of this article pointed PRP to Ross 's ( 1999 ) concept of finding without seeking , which led PRP to Williamson 's ( 1998 ) article , which distinguished incidental information acquisition from purposeful information seeking . These older studies serve to remind PRP IN DT concepts employed here are not JJ , although DT ubiquity , speed , and scale of information encountered in DT age of DT internet is . Educators need to address these challenges , but where are PRP to begin ? As part of DT SHEG ( 2016 ) NN , DT researchers compared DT way students approached judging credibility with DT way professional fact ‐checkers approached DT same tasks ( Wineburg & McGrew , 2016 ) . This is an interesting and important line of research , partly because PRP compares various kinds of readers and reading purposes and partly because PRP grows from an authentic example of adult interaction with text . PRP RB see value in exploring DT relation between identity and information seeking ( Kohnen , in press ) and wonder how schools might design learning environments where students not only learn fact ‐checking skills but RB learn to value facts . DT utility of DT rules for internet searching WDT are currently and commonly taught is suspect given DT range of topics likely addressed in DT upper left quadrant of Figure 2 . When querying settled issues WDT are uncontroversial , DT rules MD make some sense . However , DT issues WDT fall into DT upper left quadrant are often those WDT are most controversial or otherwise unsettled . DT more current DT question is , DT less likely NN is to find peer ‐reviewed research on PRP ; library NNS have described this as DT information cycle . Navigating DT digital floodwaters is perhaps most treacherous when users are in unsettled territory , but if educators are to prepare students for authentic , intentional searching , is n't PRP their responsibility to help students gather information about unsettled topics ? DT high ‐stakes searches should be a high priority for schools , but DT small amount of information ‐seeking instruction currently occurring appears to be almost exclusively focused on preparing students for searches WDT fall into DT upper right quadrant of Figure 2 . Clearly , students should be exposed to what PRP means to search IN an expert and should learn to use specific websites WDT historians , NNS , literary critics , or mathematicians find highly credible . Yet , should this be DT only kind of information ‐seeking instruction WDT students receive ? After all , DT upper left quadrant of Figure 2 ( “ highly important / low preparation ” ) is a place where PRP will all find ourselves at CD point or another in our lives . Questions related to citizenship , personal finance , NN , and consumer decisions MD all fall into this quadrant . Again , based on surveys and conversations with adults of all ages , PRP conclude IN most NNS engage in intentional information seeking of all kinds at CD point or another . Examples from Angela 's perspective are included in Figure 2 for illustrative purposes , and PRP have invited dozens of adults to VB about their recent information ‐seeking endeavors in these terms . PRP hope IN this graphic will help start a conversation about what PRP means to prepare students to be successful in different kinds of searches . In all likelihood , educators will see DT low ‐stakes searches as a low priority for schools ; perhaps teachers might model via a search ‐aloud ( Saul , Kohnen , Newman , & Pearce , 2012 ) how PRP engage in low ‐stakes searches of different kinds , but otherwise these kinds of searches probably demand little curricular space . However , DT internet ‐searching rules imposed by JJ teachers do little to prepare students for DT daily information needs of adults , needs WDT are not primarily academic or even career in nature . In fact , DT banned resources are DT bedrock of JJ of DT searches WDT adults engage in as parents , moviegoers , hobbyists , and so forth ( for more on Wikipedia , see Alvermann , 2017 ) . PRP propose thinking about these needs in terms of two variables : importance ( Is DT information need high or low stakes ? ) and preparation ( How well has your education and / or experience prepared PRP to deal with DT information PRP find ? ; see Figure 2 ) . Searches undertaken in schools appear to be designed to help students succeed in formal academic environments . If DT goal of schools is to prepare students to succeed as academics in training , PRP might make sense to ban Wikipedia ; after all , academics do not usually cite tertiary sources such as Wikipedia in their formal writing . Likewise , perhaps teachers privilege .gov and .edu domain names because PRP associate these domains with an editorial process , and some teachers MD encourage students to VB to DT databases in an attempt to steer them toward peer ‐reviewed resources . PRP appears IN most teachers recognize how difficult navigating DT digital floodwaters is for students and believe IN rules are needed as basic signposts or clues . Yet , these rules do not teach students to assess DT credibility of online information as a nuanced or critical thinking activity . Instead , these inflexible rules mask differences between websites WDT MD have a similar domain name or DT same suffix ; do not account for DT various kinds of information WDT exist online ( e.g. , blogs , newspapers , magazines , commercial product sites , professional and amateur videos ) ; and privilege academic searches over other kinds of information seeking , as PRP discuss next . Since 2009 , PRP have been collecting survey , focus group , and interview data on DT ways WDT students are being taught to access information online . PRP have RB talked informally with teachers as part of other projects WDT take PRP into schools . Our respondents came from urban , suburban , and rural upper elementary , middle , and high school classrooms ( grades 4 – 12 ) in schools in DT U.S. Midwest and Southeast . PRP RB discussed internet searching with a group of college students at a highly selective university ( see Kohnen & Saul , 2017 ) . Based on several hundred responses , DT following trends became apparent : Compounding DT problem , high ‐stakes tests , including NN tests such as those developed by Smarter Balanced and DT Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers , as well as college entrance exams such as DT SAT and ACT , do not currently demand IN students find their own information . Rather , tests are scored on students ' ability to read provided texts and cite relevant details from those texts in a coherent essay WDT answers someone else 's question . In this environment , PRP have even heard principals characterize student curiosity as a potential distraction WDT must be managed . In sum , DT answer to DT question about whether DT curriculum allots space and NN for students ' own queries and curiosities is often no or at least not enough . Since DT Common Core NNP Standards ( National Governors Association Center for Best Practices & Council of Chief NNP School Officers , 2010 ) were unveiled , schools across DT NNP NNPS have devoted more NN to informational and other kinds of nonfiction texts ( see RB DT National Assessment of Educational Progress frameworks , on which DT Common Core 's reading and writing distributions were based ) . However , as noted earlier , these texts are typically teacher selected or curriculum dictated , with little input or effort on DT part of students . Surely , teaching students to read and engage with complex nonfiction is a challenging task , and working with class texts MD be a necessary or effective way to introduce certain skills or engage in whole ‐group discussions . Yet , without NN and space to explore their own questions and curiosities , students have little chance to practice their intentional information ‐seeking skills in personal and motivating contexts . Understandably , teachers express worry IN DT curriculum is already too crowded ; DT unpredictability of student ‐driven information seeking MD feel , in CD teacher 's words , “ just too hard . ” As this list makes clear , DT information sought MD be serious or trivial , uncontested or complex . Because intentional information acquisition implies action ( from finding directions to choosing a diet plan to deciding how to vote ) , PRP RB involves skills : DT skills to seek , find , assess , and comprehend a wide variety of texts ( often in a variety of modalities ) . Curriculum developers have deemed some information important and purposefully ignored other informational needs . For instance , few teachers teach or grade a young person 's ability to follow a baseball team 's efforts , even though PRP MD recognize this effort as useful , engaging , and perhaps even wholesome . At DT other end of DT information –acquisition continuum sits incidental information , DT information WDT PRP are all exposed to on a near ‐constant basis . DT term incidental seems to imply IN information is simply sprayed about and hits some of PRP . This is , to a limited extent , DT case : An airport blasts PRP with television NN , and a YouTube video is available only if CD first watches an advertisement . Other forms of incidental information are targeted based on who PRP is ( e.g. , DT targeted ads and articles WDT pop up on our computer screens ) , where CD lives , or what PRP does . Regardless of why this non‐sought ‐out information comes to PRP , DT amount of incidental information WDT PRP encounter is astounding , as recent studies have estimated ( see Bohn & Short , 2012 ; Short , 2013 ) . Schools have historically sought to ignore incidental information , despite DT fact IN PRP composes a huge proportion of DT information diet . Yet , to bring incidental information and ideas thoughtfully into DT curriculum , educators need to recognize first IN incidental information is , in fact , a fund of knowledge . Until incidental information is recognized as such , educators will not be able to analyze its sources , its effects , or its role in students ' lives . JJ scholars have discussed DT disconnect between home and school literacies , particularly for students whose home cultures do not align with DT culture represented by their school ( e.g. , Heath , 1983 ; Moje , Ciechanowski , & Kramer , 2004 ) . In this same sense , PRP is important to note IN incidental information should be considered a literacy WDT MD or MD not align with school discourse . Imagine DT information WDT students are exposed to as part of their everyday , out ‐of ‐school lives through no seemingly active effort on their part : television and radio programs ; websites WDT happen to be up on a computer or tablet when a student sits down to play or work with PRP ; physical copies of magazines , newspapers , and books in DT home ; and automatic texts or RSS feeds WDT appear on a phone or in an e‐mail inbox . These sources often RB inspire adult conversations WDT students MD join or simply overhear . More important perhaps is DT information picked up in dinnertime conversations or on outings with family members or friends . DT sheer amount of incidental information WDT students are exposed to outside of school MD be a critical component of school success . In studies WDT focused on physical resources , Neuman and Celano ( 2001 ) and Neuman and Moland ( 2016 ) found socioeconomic differences in access to print for very young NNS , with NNS in low ‐income neighborhoods having fewer print resources available . Neuman and Moland coined DT term book deserts to describe DT lack of physical books in areas of concentrated poverty . PRP suspect IN EX MD be similar differences in DT amount of incidental information WDT students are exposed to outside of schools and , surely , differences in DT types and sources of such information , such as DT kinds of books , magazines , and newspapers in DT home ; access to high ‐speed internet and DT technologies to take advantage of PRP ; and adult conversations around incidental information . In other words , experiences with incidental information often help students do better ( or worse ) in schools . DT issue here is CD of alignment . Although DT amount and content of incidental information WDT young NNS are exposed to MD differ across socioeconomic classes , a proposition WDT PRP have not investigated , all residents living in DT NNP NNPS in DT 21st century are exposed to a great deal of incidental information . Yet , when incidental information aligns nicely with DT discourses of school , DT bar for learning JJ information in school is relatively low . However , when DT incidental information to which students are exposed ( perhaps because of class , culture , neighborhood , or other reasons ) is quite different from or at odds with school discourses , DT bar for school success is much higher . VBN differently , experiences with incidental information likely make school harder or easier for students . In contrast to a deficit model of thinking , Moll and colleagues ( e.g. , Moll , 2015 ; Moll , Amanti , Neff , & Gonzalez , 1992 ) focused on resource ‐based pedagogy , a way of teaching WDT builds on what students , families , and communities VBP ( i.e. , their funds of knowledge ) . Inspired by Moll , PRP ask , How might incidental information be considered a fund of knowledge ? How might teachers learn what incidental information makes up DT backdrop of their students ' lives and use this information as a resource for teaching ? From a student perspective and by our own definition of non‐sought ‐out knowledge , DT school curriculum often , if not always , focuses on incidental information . DT curriculum is typically determined by someone else and is presented to students with very little , if any , input on their part . Even when students are in classrooms WDT promote active learning , DT activity is almost always focused on learning predetermined concepts about predetermined topics ; as noted earlier , in JJ schools , very little NN is dedicated to students ' own curiosities and queries . However , CD of DT gifts of an exceptional teacher is DT ability to inspire students to move from passive information acquisition to active , intentional information seeking , often about topics WDT DT students never considered before . Curricular units almost always start with students in a passive role in terms of topic , concept , or information to be learned ; DT is , although PRP MD be engaged in active learning , PRP usually have not selected DT curriculum itself . Yet , through DT guidance of a teacher , students can take an active interest in finding out more . For example , Wendy ( second author ) recently witnessed an upper elementary NN teacher teaching a unit on animals native to DT NN . Inspired by their teacher 's enthusiasm , students eagerly researched a bird and wrote individual entries for a class book on “ what makes native birds cool . ” PRP doubt IN JJ of DT students in this class MD have chosen to seek out bird information on their own prior to their teacher 's invitation , but PRP found her enthusiasm and deep interest in their research irresistible . PRP suggest IN our continuum of information acquisition MD be useful for teachers as PRP VBP about DT curriculum from DT perspective of their students . Engaging students in active learning is not a JJ concept , of course , but DT intentional end of DT continuum is specifically about active seeking , not just activity in terms of classroom talk or movement . Our respect and even love for education was built on DT efforts of influential teachers who inspired PRP to VB to VB more about a topic previously viewed as foreign and perhaps even boring . Although such engagement likely cannot happen for every student during every unit , including more opportunities for active , intentional information seeking on curricular topics is a reasonable goal . Finally , PRP wonder how schools can equip students to recognize and respond appropriately when incidental information is a distraction . Today , adults and NNS alike struggle to manage DT onslaught of incidental information . Incidental information , in DT form of background radio or television programs or DT constant influx of e‐mail and text messages , is ubiquitous . Images of couples staring at screens rather than making conversation and parents pushing NNS on swings while checking their phones have become cliché , but PRP RB represent a frightening reality . Our students today live with a 24 ‐ hour NN cycle WDT must manufacture NN to fill airtime ; JJ RB believe in DT myth of multitasking and attempt to do homework while clicking back and forth among multiple information feeds . Learning to shut down or limit DT flow of incidental information , or at least judge when PRP is worthy of attention , MD be an overlooked 21st ‐century literacy skill .

text: Use of color - coded bandannas in DT gay and BDSM communities DT handkerchief code ( RB known as DT hanky code , DT bandana code , and flagging [ 1 ] ) is a color - coded system , employed usually among DT gay male casual - sex seekers or BDSM practitioners in DT NNP NNPS , Canada , Australia and Europe , to indicate preferred sexual fetishes , what kind of sex PRP are seeking , and whether PRP are a top / dominant or bottom / submissive . Wearing a handkerchief on DT left side of DT body typically indicates PRP is a " top " ( CD considered active in DT practice of DT act / fetish indicated by DT color of DT handkerchief ) , while wearing PRP on DT right side of DT body MD indicate CD is a " bottom " ( CD considered passive in DT practice of DT act / fetish indicated by DT color of DT handkerchief ) . DT hanky code was widely used in DT 1970s by gay and bisexual men . DT wearing of various colored bandanas around DT neck was common in DT mid- and late - nineteenth century among cowboys , steam railroad engineers , and miners in DT Western NNP NNPS . PRP is thought IN DT wearing of bandanas by gay men originated in San Francisco after DT Gold Rush , when , because of a shortage of women , men dancing with each other in square dances developed a code wherein DT man wearing DT blue bandana took DT male part in DT square dance , and DT man wearing DT red bandana took DT female part ( these bandanas were usually worn around DT arm or hanging from DT belt or in DT back pocket of PRP 's jeans ) . [ 2 ] PRP is thought IN DT modern hanky code started in NNP York City in late 1970 or early 1971 when a journalist for DT Village Voice joked IN instead of simply wearing keys to indicate whether someone was a " top " or a " bottom " , PRP MD be more efficient to subtly announce their particular sexual focus by wearing different colored hankies . [ 3 ] Other sources attribute DT expansion of DT original red–blue system into today 's code to marketing efforts around 1971 by DT San Francisco department store for erotic merchandise , DT Trading Post , promoting handkerchiefs by printing cards listing DT meanings of various colors . [ 4 ] Alan Selby , founder of Mr. S Leather in San Francisco , claimed IN he created DT first hanky code with his business partners at Leather ' n ' Things in 1972 , when their bandana supplier inadvertently doubled their order and DT expanded code MD help them sell DT extra colors PRP had received . [ 5 ] Bob Damron 's Address Book is RB notable when referencing DT Handkerchief Code . Starting in 1964 , a businessman by DT name of Bob Damron published a book of all DT gay bars he knew from his constant travels across DT NNP NNPS . “ This book fit comfortably in DT palm of your hand , ” a description reads . “ Despite its petite size , this book was an impressive accomplishment . Each CD of DT listings he had visited himself . Every last copy of DT book he sold himself . ” [ 2 ] Bob Damron 's Address Book RB published a yearly chart for DT meaning of each colored hanky under DT title " COLOR CODES " . [ 2 ] This table is drawn from Larry Townsend 's DT Leatherman 's Handbook II ( DT 1983 second edition ; DT 1972 first edition did not include this list ) and is generally considered authoritative . Implicit in this list is DT concept of left / right polarity , left as usual indicating DT top , dominant , or active partner ; right DT bottom , submissive , or passive partner . Negotiation with a prospective partner remains important because , as Townsend noted , NNS MD wear hankies of any color " only because DT idea of DT hankie turns them on " or " MD not even VB what PRP means " . [ 6 ] DT longer lists found on DT web are more elaborate and DT JJ color codes in them are less often used in practice , although some of these colors are offered for sale at LGBT stores along with free cards listing their meanings . While DT hankie code was a semiotic system of sexual advertising popular among DT gay leather community of DT NNP NNPS [ 7 ] , PRP is no longer as popular in DT modern day era . PRP MD be seen as something kinkier to use in gay pornography , or at sex and fetish events IN DT Folsom Street Fair . Social networks MD have replaced DT use of hankies in cruising areas by digitizing DT process . By using online platforms , men who have sex with men ( MSM ) can eliminate harassment and violence WDT PRP MD face in NN . [ 8 ] Social networks for MSM RB allow for sub - groups , and for NNS to list fetishes , and what PRP are looking for , which is where DT replacement of DT need for hankies MD have come from . [ 8 ] Grindr is DT most popular app for MSM who use social networks for cruising , with an average of 1.3 hours per day spent on DT app per user . [ 9 ] • None Jacques , Trevor H. ( 1993 ) . text: SO WHAT’D PRP VBP OF MEGYN KELLY ’S ALEX JONES FEATURE LAST NIGHT ? Putting aside DT fiery debate about whether Kelly and NBC NNP were right to give such primo airtime to a man who has spread dangerous NN theories IN Pizzagate and DT Sandy Hook hoax nonsense , DT question for JJ journalists ahead of last night ’s highly - anticipated “ Sunday Night with Megyn Kelly ” segment was all about how tough Kelly MD prove to be in grilling her controversial subject -- just three weeks into her JJ program , at DT . Given how high DT stakes were as a result of last week ’s JJ outcry , PRP assumes DT editors at NBC NNP were working overtime to make sure DT piece was as tough as possible . And given DT favorable reviews , PRP assumes DT network is happy with DT . -- DT Infowars boss downplayed his relationship with NNP NNP : “ I VBP my influence on NNP is way way lower than what MSM has VBN . ” Kelly : “ Well what kind of access do PRP have ? ” Jones : “ He 's just called sometimes and , PRP VBP , talked about politics or thanked me , stuff IN DT . DT 's PRP . ” -- Ridiculous statement : “ DT NN never covers all DT evil wars PRP ’s promoted . ” Kelly responded , “ DT does n’t excuse what PRP VBD about Newtown , and PRP VBP PRP . ” But really , she coulda / shoulda nailed him on DT “ NN does n’t cover wars ” part . -- This is more IN PRP : “ PRP misstated facts about Chobani and its owner which , PRP MD ’ve found out if PRP just had a reporter do a little shoe - leather reporting -- pick up DT phone , check out DT facts . PRP never MD have had to retract DT or apologize . ” -- “ Do PRP VB of yourself as a journalist ? ” Jones : “ I have some journalists WDT work for me and I do journalistic work and I ’ve broken a lot of big stories and I understand DT basics of PRP . ” If PRP missed PRP last night , PRP can watch DT full clip . Veteran CNN TV critic Brian Lowry : “ [ T ] he piece WDT aired Sunday credibly justified covering DT Infowars phenomenon , which was DT bar WDT " Sunday Night With Megyn Kelly " ultimately had to clear . … Moving into a prosecutorial mode WDT was frequently her strength on Fox , Kelly did press him , enlisting a Newtown parent and MSNBC contributor Charlie Sykes to help contextualize DT ‘ toxic paranoia ’ WDT he spreads among his listeners . … Kelly 's handling of DT interview should calm some nerves [ at NBC NNP ] , even if PRP wo n't quiet all DT dissenting voices . ” Our own Jack Shafer : “ [ S ] he took DT mendacious Jones apart in such a textbook manner PRP had to wonder what all DT shouting had been about . … Short of waterboarding him , I do n’t VB what more Kelly MD have done to expose Jones ’ dark methods . ” TIPS AND COMMENTS : / . Morning NN is edited by Alex Weprin ( / ) and produced with writing / reporting help from Cristiano Lima ( / ) . Archives . Subscribe . EXCERPT - From my feature this morning , “ DT Not - So - Bitter Rivalry of Dean Baquet and Marty Baron , ” over at POLITICO Magazine : “ Baron and Baquet are DT two most important newspaper editors in America right now , at a NN when DT NN is tackling DT most epic and consequential story of DT past 40 NNS . … JJ NN organizations have been moving DT needle on DT NNP story in different ways … But when PRP comes to inside reports from intelligence and national security agencies , DT Times and DT Post , with their expanding rosters of veteran correspondents , have DT greatest institutional advantages . In particular , DT investigations into whether DT NNP team colluded with Russia in DT 2016 election have played to DT historic strengths of both newspapers . … DT result has been a resurgence of ink-stained combat WDT makes NYT v. WaPo DT most compelling journalistic rivalry since DT days of Baquet and Baron ’s respective forefathers , Abe Rosenthal and Ben Bradlee . DT other thing WDT makes DT rivalry compelling is IN unlike Rosenthal and Bradlee , who were cordial at most , Baron and Baquet are legit pals . ... “ And yet , looking back on their journeys to DT ivory towers of American journalism , PRP ’s equally clear IN Baron and Baquet have been formidable competitors , if collegial ones , over DT course of their professional lives . Perhaps no two editors ’ careers have overlapped and shadowed CD another so closely . In DT past , PRP ’ve each contended to be DT top editor at DT NNP York Times and to have all DT power and influence WDT goes along with PRP . After decades of ups and downs for both men , Baquet eventually got DT job , but at DT same NN , Baron got DT glory and fame WDT only DT most Herculanean journalistic achievements can confer . Now , their competition defines not only their careers but , to no small degree , DT fate of DT NNP administration . Every morning , each goes to work knowing IN part of what he needs to do DT day is to be better and faster than DT other . ” DT ’s DT nut graph , in a nutshell . PRP can read DT rest . ( PRP ’s long , so I wo n’t be offended if PRP bookmark and save for later . ) SIDENOTE : SOME POST NUMBERS WDT SURFACED IN MY REPORTING - “ A person with knowledge of company finances VBD DT Post now has more than 900,000 digital - only subscribers at three monthly access levels — $ 3.99 , $ 9.99 and $ 14.99 — with DT majority of its customers registered at DT higher two tiers . Based on those numbers , digital subscriptions MD theoretically be in DT ballpark of $ 100 million at this point . ( In 2016 , digital circulation at DT Times was $ 232.8 million . ) ... Digital advertising this NN , according to DT person with knowledge of company finances , is projected to be at least $ 120 million , up from roughly $ 100 million in 2016 . ( Digital ad revenue at DT Times in 2016 was $ 208.8 million . ) Since DT Post , as opposed to DT Times , is a private company and does not make its finances NN , PRP MD n’t hurt to take these subscription and revenue numbers with a grain of salt . ” -- “ Watching @megynkelly interview with Alex Jones , I 'm even more convinced IN her piece was n't just ok to do , but important journalism . ” [ ] -- “ Bottom line on NBC's Alex Jones piece : Strong editing gave PRP an edge & made him look IN a kook . Still a win for him ; boosts his profile . ” [ ] -- “ If PRP 're unfamiliar with Alex Jones , and are watching this Megyn Kelly report , hard to imagine PRP walk away believing anything he says . And fwiw , I VBP she 's done about as good as anyone can do on TV taking him to task on JJ of his conspiracies . ” [ ] -- “ PRP MD see DT producers cutting and re-cutting PRP to meet various points of objection . ” [ ] BILL O’REILLY TEASES POSSIBLE ‘ JJ NETWORK ’ - : “ Making DT first stop at his ‘ DT Spin Stops Here ’ tour , O’Reilly ... made some NN during DT question - and - answer period ... Asked whether he planned to start his own network , he VBD ‘ EX MD be a JJ network ’ WDT will compete directly with Fox NNP . ‘ A bunch of NNS are looking to compete with Fox because EX ’s a perception ’ of decline , he VBD . … “ But I am starting my own operation . PRP are VBG to do DT … where PRP will VB into a studio and here PRP will look IN ‘ DT Factor . ’ . . . PRP ’s basically an experiment to see how JJ NNS are VBG to VB this service . DT ’s coming and will be here before September in a robust form . But I suspect EX will be another network maybe merging with PRP . EX will be a network WDT rises up because DT numbers for Fox are VBG down . ” DONALD NNP AND RUPERT MURDOCH , A HISTORY - From DT Guardian over DT weekend : “ DT alliance between Donald NNP and Rupert Murdoch has never been stronger . … Now , with a reported criminal investigation in connection with sexual harassment allegations into Fox NNP , DT stakes are higher than ever for DT two friends . … As NNP ’s ‘ inevitability ’ grew and PRP became clear he was VBG to win DT Republican nomination , DT two men grew closer still , uniting around what is perhaps DT biggest thing PRP have in common : both men love to win , and suddenly PRP were in a position to use CD another to do just DT . ” Sid Blumenthal : “ His entire empire ’s at stake – DT ’s why Murdoch is talking to him every day . PRP ’s not because he enjoys DT sparkling conversation of Donald NNP . ” More : “ ” -- “ Before DT Gunfire in Virginia , a Volatile Home Life in Illinois ” [ ] -- David Remnick : “ Who in DT White House Will Turn Against Donald NNP ” [ ] ERIC BOLLING FOR SENATE ? : “ Fox NNP anchor Eric Bolling MD have just signed a JJ multi- NN contract , but he ’s RB eyeing a possible career NN : A future run for Senate . For now , Bolling is secure in his job as co-host of DT JJ show ‘ DT Fox NNP Specialists . ’ But In a recent telephone interview from Fox NNP headquarters in NNP York City , Bolling VBD IN ‘ when DT lights VBP down on DT TV career ’ he wants to make a primary challenge against a sitting Republican senator in DT South . ‘ A lot of Republicans run as conservatives only to be elected , and PRP find out PRP ’re not conservative at all . ’ … Bolling … declined to specify which NN in DT South he ’d run , which senator he MD challenge or even when PRP MD happen . ” BIG UNIVISION FEATURE FROM JIM RUTENBERG - : “ By now PRP ’ve probably heard IN this is a golden age for journalism -- how DT NNP York Times and DT Washington Post are warring for scoops in ways reminiscent of DT Watergate era ; how an information - hungry NN is sending subscriptions and television NN ratings soaring , reinvigorating journalists and reaffirming their mission … But DT story is n’t complete if PRP does n’t include Univision NNP , CD of DT most striking examples I ’ve seen all NN of a NN organization WDT is meeting DT moment . PRP is DT leading NN source for Hispanics in DT NNP NNPS , citizen and noncitizen alike -- a core audience WDT has an almost existential stake in DT NNP administration ’s policies . ” More : “ ” REVOLVING DOOR : : “ Emma Carmichael , DT editor in chief of Jezebel , announced on Friday IN she 's stepping down from DT position next month . ‘ This has been DT hardest decision of my professional life , but PRP ’s CD I feel clear - headed about — I ’m simply a little burnt out and ready to take a break from running a website , ’ she wrote in a memo to her staff . … Carmichael becomes DT third woman in a leadership position to leave Gizmodo NNP Group in as JJ months . … But DT company has RB made increasing gender diversity a priority . ” -- Margaret Sullivan : “ When student journalists need defending , these lawyers swoop in . text: DT NNP York Times Makes Another Attempt to Normalize Pedophilia PRP should begin with DT 2014 opinion piece published by DT NYT WDT , shockingly , few are familiar with . DT article is entitled , “ Pedophilia : A Disorder , Not a Crime . ” PRP begins , “ VB back to your first childhood crush . Maybe PRP was a classmate or a friend next door .. ” doing their best to associate this sickening practice with our first feelings of love , otherwise implying IN PRP is natural , if not normal . In what can only be seen as shameless pandering to those behind DT scenes , DT article goes on from RB to make DT assertion IN pedophiles are neither responsible for DT crimes PRP commit , nor do PRP have DT ability to stop themselves , effectively relieving these damaged individuals of all culpability and accountability for their actions . DT author goes as far as to label DT crime a “ disability , ” with potential discrimination thereof . DT writer makes DT claim IN DT laws currently in place in DT NNP are , “ inconsistent and irrational , ” and argues IN these child molesters should be sent for treatment , as opposed to serving prison NN for their heinous acts against DT most defenseless of PRP all . This is despite DT overwhelming numbers WDT show just how often these “ victims of impulse , ” as DT writer is trying to frame them , are “ victims ” of recidivism ; DT tendency of a convicted criminal to re-offend . According to Harvard NNP School , estimates of recidivism among sexual offenders vary because studies define this term in different ways . CD such Harvard review found recidivism rates as high as 50 % among pedophiles . PRP MD be thinking , this is exactly why these troubled individuals need treatment , as DT author suggests . No NN can argue IN CD with such sickening desires does not need treatment , as DT seems to be a foregone conclusion . However , DT issue in question is whether or not IN treatment actually works , and most importantly , whether or not treatment can be , or should be , used in place of a correctional facility , as DT author dangerously advocates . A 2004 NN published in DT International Journal of Offender Therapy and Comparative Criminology , which included 109 convicted sex offenders who completed therapy and 37 who dropped out , showed IN DT “ non-completers , ” were in fact more likely to commit another sexual crime . DT point being , DT treatment does work to a certain degree and is important , as JJ can attest to , but not in place of a correctional facility when considering violent sexual criminals — and for CD very clear reason . Researchers of DT NN noted IN sex offenders who completed DT therapy were not any more likely to show empathy toward their past victims . This , in DT opinion of some , shows a willingness to complete DT therapy so as to move past PRP , but not with DT intention to VB better . DT lack of empathy is a very important note , as DT researchers documented , as PRP shows a lack of remorse . How can PRP feel IN treatment for such a horrendous crime is effective if DT perpetrator never shows any remorse for DT acts PRP committed ? DT running theme throughout DT article is IN those who engage in pedophilia , should not be treated as criminals , but as victims themselves , despite DT fact IN potentially half of them will victimize another child in DT near future , and even those who complete DT treatment were no more likely so show remorse for those PRP abused . PRP MD come to all kinds of conclusions about why this article was written , and what DT intentions truly were , but at DT end of DT day , PRP MD be chalked up to any number of agendas or personal experiences , on its own . DT next aspect to consider , was DT abysmally bad coverage by DT NNP York Times , of all DT surrounding events and criminal acts in regard to DT investigation WDT became known as “ Pizzagate . ” Now to be clear , PRP must do away with visions of Hillary NNP in a pizza parlor basement with kids chained to DT walls . As I do not doubt IN these sinister individuals MD do , or have done just DT , in DT case of this investigation , those bullet points are being used to discredit and distract from DT larger truth behind DT scenes , and were likely thrown out when researchers began to VB a bit too close , as with DT case of Laura Silsby . On numerous occasions while “ covering ” DT Pizzagate investigation , DT NNP York Times editorial staff took PRP upon themselves to ignore their charge as journalists to hold those in power accountable , and instead chose to completely omit DT evidence at hand , in order to pander to DT very individuals under scrutiny for pedophilia . And DT few articles DT failing organization did choose to put out on DT topic were shockingly devoid of any critical analysis of DT information , while inserting their own feelingsabout DT case , and “ NN theorists ” as a whole . DT is not journalism , its propaganda . EX is far too much information surrounding this case to rehash PRP all in a single article ( for those interested , TLAV has done extensive research into DT case , as have JJ others such as Titus Frost ) , yet PRP is not hard to see , even with a cursory glance , IN EX is truth to these claims backed up by some pretty damning evidence , as JJ are beginning to see . Which brings PRP to a recent NYT piece entitled , “ Why I Admire Anthony Weiner ; ” and yes , PRP was written after Weiner was arrested and sentenced to prison for acts of pedophilia . This NN speaks for itself . And EX is no hidden meaning , no metaphor to be had — as if DT MD make PRP any better , should DT writer have some grand conclusion and explanation for why she is openly admiring a convicted pedophile . DT writer is simply making DT case for why she admires his conduct during his trial , for which he was being held accountable , and rightly so , for his illegal actions with a 15 - NN - old girl . In essence , DT author is saying IN Weiner chose to take DT high road , in accepting IN he was responsible for his crime instead of blaming DT NN , as JJ often do . Yet this is a blatant attempt to minimize DT negative press of both Weiner and DT Democratic party . Despite him no longer holding a position , PRP still reflects very badly on DT party , which is why PRP went to their knee - jerk political propaganda arm , DT NNP York Times , to pump out a fluff piece . In astonishingly oblivious fashion , DT writer ignores DT NNS of lies and manipulation WDT preceded Weiner ’s display of what can only be seen as regret for being caught , as opposed to actual remorse . How can PRP be admirable to sexually abuse an underage girl , lie about PRP for NNS , allow Hillary NNP to cover PRP up for PRP , wait until PRP have PRP dead to rights , still deny DT charges , then sobbingly admit to them in court when confronted with DT overwhelming evidence ? DT ’s easy , PRP ’s not . What PRP are witnessing here is what amounts to DT acceptance and normalization of child abuse by DT NNP York Times , in order to cover for some much larger issue at play . God only knows what those are … ( well , and DT independent NN ) Ryan Cristian is DT author of website , DT Last American Vagabond . text: Steve Huffman , DT chief executive of Reddit , knows he has some explaining to do . Huffman , RB a Reddit co-founder , landed in hot NN Wednesday after admitting IN he used his administrative powers to secretly edit user comments WDT were critical of him on r/ Donald - a popular , pro-Trump forum ( or " subreddit " ) . He swapped all mentions of his own username with DT names of DT pro-Trump group 's leaders , meaning IN expletive - laden posts aimed at him looked instead as if PRP were insulting DT group 's leaders . PRP was not a good idea , he told DT Post Friday by phone . " I abused my power to give DT bullies a hard NN , " he VBD . Huffman thought of his name - swapping as a joke : a way to poke back at DT NNS who 've been harassing him and some of DT site 's volunteer moderators for months . PRP was not taken DT way . Huffman 's admission fanned DT flames of controversy WDT had been surrounding DT subreddit - and its relationship with Reddit - for months . PRP RB capped off what had already been a long week . Reddit was already warring with self - proclaimed NNP supporters after shutting down a subreddit devoted to " pizzagate " -- DT claim IN EX is secret child sex - trafficking ring run by prominent Democrats . DT NNP York Times and others have debunked this theory . DT company deleted DT group for revealing NNS 's personal information . DT subreddit and its users are known for promoting NN theories and fake NN across Reddit , and gleefully invading and bombarding DT rest of DT platform with pro-Trump memes . In fact , PRP was so effective at flooding DT site 's front page with aggressive memes and posts WDT Reddit changed its algorithm over DT summer to try to limit its reach . Nearly all of DT abuse directed at Huffman , he VBD , came from avid posters to r/The . After Huffman 's admission , JJ in DT pro-Trump group demanded his resignation ; he has not addressed those calls . Huffman told DT Post IN he had been letting DT abuse from DT subreddit 's users roll off him , but then wondered if turning DT other cheek was setting a bad example . " If Donald had done this to another Reddit employee , I MD have banned them , " he VBD . He VBD he intended to swap DT names for just a few hours - despite DT fact IN doing so violates Reddit employee policies - just to give DT subreddit 's moderators a taste of what he goes through on a daily basis . Then , he VBD , he intended to put everything back . Still , DT decision to step in and directly edit user comments was a surprising move from Huffman , who has often VBN Reddit 's purpose is to provide a place for communities of all stripes to set up their own groups . Reddit has struggled to address communities who regularly test DT boundaries of its guidelines , or outright break them . In 2015 , PRP introduced JJ anti-harassment rules and banned a handful of subreddits WDT regularly violated DT site 's guidelines - including two forums dedicated to " fat - shaming , " and CD WDT existed to coordinate harassment of members of a progressive gaming site . DT bans sparked an all - out war between DT company and DT small but dedicated extreme subreddits - some of which had used Reddit to circulate stolen photos , among other things . Reddit 's former interim CEO , Ellen Pao , resigned in DT middle of DT war last NN ; Huffman succeeded her . And since he took over , Huffman has maintained IN Reddit will not interfere with users ' posts , as long as PRP stayed within DT basic guidelines . To take a step across DT line , especially for a joke , is a major departure from DT philosophy . " What he did completely destroys DT credibility of Reddit , " wrote UnimatrixZeroOne , a Reddit moderator who " out of anger " released screen shots of Slack conversations Thursday between Reddit moderators , admins and Huffman about DT altered posts . Huffman confirmed on Friday IN DT images were authentic . In those conversations , some of DT site 's other moderators expressed frustration with DT pro-Trump subreddit and asked Huffman to ban PRP for repeatedly violating guidelines . CD wrote IN DT group 's members had released personally identifying information about others during DT election season . DT person RB mentioned receiving specific threats : " Car vandalism , pipe bomb threat ( specific ) . Rallying calls to ruin my personal life , " DT moderator wrote . Huffman 's distaste for DT group is clear , but DT chats showed he does not agree with banning PRP outright . " PRP make PRP seem IN I do n't care about figuring out t , " Huffman wrote later in DT chat , VBG on to say IN " banning PRP , " as JJ of DT moderators had asked , " MD create a mess . " ( DT moderators regularly abbreviate " Donald " to " t " or " td . " ) " PRP managed to pull a move WDT actually unified PRP with them against this mistake , " CD moderator replied . Even Reddit users WDT do n't support NNP have criticized Huffman . " I ca n't stand DT thought of NNP entering DT White House , but I have to stand up to this , " VBD CD commenter on DT site . " PRP 's wrong and totally unprofessional . PRP 's VBG to zap any trust NNS have with DT organization . " Huffman VBD he knows what he did MD set a bad precedent WDT MD hurt users ' trust in DT site . But he RB VBD , having seen this torrent of abuse first hand , IN he will have Reddit step up its efforts to let users filter out negative content , and to take on DT general problem of harassment . He did n't offer a timeline for those steps . But , he promised , PRP will have more finesse than his ill - received attempt at a joke . " I had my fun with them , PRP had their fun with me , " he VBD . " But PRP are not VBG to tolerate harassment for any others . "

text: Weight Watchers has announced IN music producer and inspirational social NN poster DJ Khaled will be its “ social NN ambassador ” for 2018 . While he MD not be giving away cars to a live studio audience or have a much - shopped list of his favorite things IN his fellow endorser Oprah Winfrey , DT lion - obsessed hitmaker and Justin Bieber and Chance DT Rapper collaborator is a natural choice for DT position , as he has 3.92 million Twitter followers , boasts 8.9 million Instagram followers , and receives 3 to 4 million views per snap on his entertaining and motivating Snapchat stories . DT music producer is currently on DT WW Freestyle program , a Weight Watchers initiative WDT launched last month featuring more “ free or zero - point ” foods and JJ “ rollover points . ” Khaled shared DT exciting NN with his mega - following in a series of Instagrams and Snapchats featuring DT meals he claims to be enjoying on DT WW Freestyle program . “ In full 2018 mode ... excited to be living this # WWFreestyle life with PRP , ” he captioned DT first in DT series of videos on Instagram . “ I already Got rid of 20 pounds and ready for more . Ride with me on my journey to greatness . Bless up Weight Watchers !!! # 2018secured what I love about this PRP ’s a life style and I still can enjoy at DT same NN ride wit me though this journey ! I CAN SHOW PRP BETTER THAN I CAN TELL PRP ... I ’m so focused let ’s VB ! ! ” DT videos RB feature Khaled ’s adorable son Asahd , to whom he credits DT motivation for a lifestyle NN in 2018 . “ Weight Watchers is all about being great and being your best self . My son is my love , my life , and I need to be great for him , ” he VBD . text: EX is a shared concern for these monographs . Both books are concerned with how DT nature of groups , taken together with our evolved psychology , can explain informational dynamics . Their central explanatory targets are DT spread and persistence of falsities , DT success or failure of charismatic demagogues , and DT baffling attractiveness of turgid academic prose . Yet DT JJ examples WDT Acerbi and Mercier focus on — do I share this post ? Spread DT rumor ? Believe those doomsayers ?— tend to have low costs and consequences . DT category of reflective beliefs , in fact , can be read as a mechanism for explaining why beliefs with seemingly high costs ( being a ‘ 911 truther ’ , say ) nonetheless do not have DT costs PRP are purported to have ( IN refusing all engagement with a presumed to be corrupt NN ) . Reflective beliefs just are n’t acted upon . EX is CD possible exception . Mercier discusses a kind of action he calls ‘ bridge - burning ’ . These involve making statements WDT are unacceptable and offensive to a group . PRP might VB then , IN these are high - cost actions . And in CD sense PRP are : PRP reduce or eliminate opportunities for collaboration , communication , and exchange with DT aggrieved party . But in another sense PRP are not . These ‘ bridge - burning ’ exercises are , on Mercier ’s framework , a means of ingratiating oneself to a different , friendlier group — PRP increase PRP ’s credibility with this JJ group precisely because PRP has nowhere else to turn . And this is why Mercier thinks PRP have mechanisms for assessing DT receptivity of our claims : PRP need to VB whether PRP ’ll find a welcome party when all routes out are ashes . ‘ Bridge - burning ’ can be a high - risk strategy . But EX are plenty of situations WDT are high - risk , high - cost , and made under conditions of uncertainty — do I invest in this method or DT CD ? Do I signal my affiliation to those guys or these ones ? When do I join in ? Such high - stakes social and JJ situations occur in JJ situations where informational dynamics , judgement aggregation , and group dynamics come together in highly context - sensitive ways . Acerbi ’s book is sensitive to these issues , and introduces some tools for measuring DT organization of social networks , DT strength of connections , and DT availability of information . For instance , Acerbi notes IN JJ social NN platforms tend to have networks with a ‘ hub - JJ ’ or ‘ star - JJ ’ network structure , where multiple individuals link to a central node . Take Donald NNP ’s twitter account , which has over seventy million followers yet only follows forty - some other accounts . His twitter network is very ‘ star - JJ ’ , with accounts connecting to his UH so JJ points radiating out of a central star . Interestingly , however , informational dynamics on these star - JJ networks can create illusions , giving “ DT misleading impression of polarization on Twitter , while , in fact , DT great majority of accounts [ are ] not or [ are ] scarcely polarized . ” ( CEDA 110 ) This is what Lerman et al. ( 2016 ) have called a ‘ majority illusion ’ ; IN despite being a minority , a population can appear to be in DT majority because of DT structural features of social networks . Footnote 7 PRP matters if PRP perceives PRP ’s self to be in DT minority . Centola et al. ( 2005 ) , for instance , have argued IN such a perception can drive DT expansion of otherwise unpopular norms . Networks WDT facilitate ‘ majority illusions ’ might thus exacerbate such spreading . Likewise , NNP ’s informational reach matters . Maybe multiple agents VBP together to discuss DT American Revolutionary War . PRP might talk about how revolutionary soldiers ‘ took over DT British airports ’ , recalling IN PRP heard this information from somewhere . Given IN multiple independent agents recall DT information , this might lend additional credence to DT claims . But DT seeming independence is false and driven by network effects : all had heard PRP from a common source , NNP ’s Fourth of July “ Salute to America . ” Footnote 8 Lest this seem IN a facile example , Mercier deploys something IN this mechanism to explain DT start of DT Iraq War and DT spread of religions ( NBY , 172–176 ) . Yet while issues around network topology creep in here - and - RB in Acerbi and Mercier ’s books , neither gives what I VBP to be sufficient attention . EX is now a large and powerful body of work on DT effects of social network topologies on information dynamics coming out of social epistemology , economics , and other literatures . DT analytic and agent - based models of these literatures show how network organization interacting with information aggregation procedures can generate surprising individual - and group - level effects . I VBP EX are plenty of reasons why both Acerbi and Mercier should VB to pay more attention this expansive literature . DT first is IN PRP provides a suite of tools , metrics , and explanatory models for understanding DT trade - offs and consequences of different network topologies , information aggregation strategies , and group compositions . These directly address DT social phenomena WDT Acerbi and Mercier target , offering a distinct perspective on DT information dynamics of innovation diffusion ( e.g. Kiesling et al. 2012 ) , testimonial norms ( e.g. Mayo - Wilson 2014 ) , and conformity effects ( e.g. Mohseni and Williams 2019 ) . DT second reason concerns DT role of background information and context in both Acerbi and Mercier ’s books . Incoming information is tested against background information for plausibility , and shapes DT trajectories of cultural NN . But this suggests IN information dynamics will be highly sensitive to DT order in which information is received — our priors can be biased and our evaluation non-commutative . This matters substantially for information dynamics , offering routes for systematic group - level disagreement ( Zollman 2010 ) , polarization ( Goldberg and Stein 2018 ) , and deviation from optimal or more veridical outcomes ( Holman and Bruner 2017 ) . And third , social network models provide contrasts to DT assumptions at work in Acerbi and Mercier . Both suggest , in more or less DT same form , IN DT “ spread of most misconceptions is explained by their intuitively appealing content , rather than by DT skills of those who propound them . ” ( NBY 260 ) This is a bold claim , especially given IN modelling results from social networks suggest IN under quite minimal assumptions , wholly rational agents can end up pursuing and perpetuating false beliefs ( O’Connor and Weatherall 2019 ) . These effects can be exacerbated by malicious actors ( ibid. ) , but can RB be produced where informational uncertainty combines with specific network topologies ( O’Connor and Weatherall 2020 ) . This is what I meant when I VBD above IN DT gullibility account is a useful foil , but IN ultimately Mercier is punching - down . Mercier associates DT gullibility account with a deferential attitude towards authority and an unquestioning acceptance of all information ; IN human beings are mindless sheeple subject to herd behavior . But DT picture endorsed by Mercier and Acerbi — with rational agents operating under uncertainty — can still generate herd - JJ behavior ( Banerjee 1992 ; Hung and Plott 2001 ) , conformity and free - riding ( List and Pettit 2004 ) , and DT persistence of misinformed groups ( Golub and Jackson 2010 ) under a wide range of plausible conditions . So I VBP EX are good reasons why Acerbi and Mercier should engage with these nearby literatures . But EX is no reason why DT engagement should be a CD - way street . JJ of DT models employed in social epistemology and economics employ sparse characterizations of human agents and their psychology . Mercier and Acerbi ’s work , by contrast , draws on experimental results from psychology , paleoanthropological evidence , and evolutionary reasoning to back substantive claims about human cognition . Feeding these psychological and evolutionary assumptions into network models might offer a means of exploring their claims about human cognitive evolution , cultural NN , and DT spread of misinformation . At DT same NN , such an exchange might generate useful helpful friction . Current network models often share a basic assumption with Acerbi and Mercier — notably , some form of rationality . PRP might VB , then , IN these models are grist to DT authors ’ evolutionary mills . But PRP might not . For JJ network models are minimal models ( Weisberg 2013 ) , WDT show how significant group level effects can be driven by few psychological assumptions . These suggest IN while DT mechanisms endorsed in Acerbi and Mercier ’s books MD be sufficient to generate DT relevant phenomena , PRP are not necessary . EX are other empirically - supported characterizations of how human beings acquire , interpret , and transmit information . How these two characterizations should be reconciled is an open question . But looking at DT rich theoretical and modelling literature in economics , social epistemology and sociology provides not only a strong juxtaposition to DT two accounts on offer , but RB a rich set of tools for exploring their hypotheses and claims . However this interaction plays out , PRP is worth closing on a positive note . Both Mercier and Acerbi ’s volumes are enjoyable , story - driven journeys . PRP guide DT reader through large and expanding literatures in an entertaining and illuminating way . PRP are upbeat about human capabilities and provide a useful optimistic counterpoint to DT recent spate of epistemological doomsayers .

text: “ If DT post - truth order is primarily marked by a generalized loss of trust in traditional sources of authority and information as well as a growing fragmentation of DT NN sphere , this book convincingly argues IN DT truth of DT post - truth condition is not to be found in DT details but within a JJ discursive space where NN and non-state actors , established powers and emerging political networks , build surprising alliances to hegemonize DT JJ sphere and upend DT post - 1989 NN order . ” “ Finally , PRP have a theory of post - truth WDT emerges from an international or JJ analysis .
